Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band around rim and glazed streaky black below; part of rosette in added white outline with added red centres; exterior: reserved (slip mostly worn); inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number 9 is written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd. Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior above two white bands (Williams 1983, 169) and many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim; several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 167, no. 98 and pl. 35, 22.) (Incorrectly labelled 1924,1201.740)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 723, no. 822)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1783) (phase 2)
